page.title: 08Cossington Women's Institute
page.content: Cossington Womens Institute,the W.I is a group of 26 village women who meet in the Jubilee Hall every month. There,lead by president Mrs.A.Smith, they hear a speaker,followed by discussion,a competition and refreshment. Some speakers this year have been a photographer,detective_sergeant, harpist,jeweller and a word_processing expert.The W.I began in 1897,to improve the life of country women and their families. Today it cares for its own small community but as a body for (this year)the problems of drug addicts, of the third world,and acid rain dangers. This year is Cossingtons 65th birthday,marked by the gift of a kettle to the Jubilee Hall.Just one founder member,Miss Emily Jordan, remains.By Mrs Alexandra Smith.
